title: Mount Rushmore National Memorial: Other Resources
body: Other Resources       Download a student guide. This guide provides information about the idea for the scuplture, the people involved and the presidents carved into Mount Rushmore. Also included are a timeline, information about some of the plants and animals and park facts. If you are a teacher searching for classroom materials, a student doing research, or a person looking for a place to spend some time, have some fun and learn in the process, LearnNPS is for you. Teaching with Historic Places (TwHP) uses properties listed in the National Park Service's National Register of Historic Places to enliven history, social studies, geography, civics, and other subjects. TwHP has created a variety of products and activities that help teachers bring historic places into the classroom.  From lesson plans based on national curriculum standards to professional development opportunities to college-level historic preservation course outlines, the National Park Service has tools that can help enliven classroom presentations and engage students in learning about history.
